properties.name: Firefly Festival
properties.description: Posted by Mathyula Firefly is a camp/Burn festival that is similar to Burning Man...just on a much smaller scale of 400 attendees. It\'s in the woods of northern Vermont for four days in the start of summer, and getting to it means getting muddy. But, when it\'s not rainy and not so muddy, Firefly is quite enchanting and inspiring. My band has played there twice. The 2005 festival was awesome...2006 got a bit rained out...but I like it just the same.

properties.name: In bed, sleeping
properties.description: Posted by InfojunkieI was in bed, sleeping, when a friend called to say that one tower had been hit by a plane. I said OK and went back to sleep. The second time he called, I knew something wasn\'t right, and got the car packed up with guns, gas and water, just in case. I ended up going to work after I heard all the planes had been grounded. If I\'d been at work on time (5 blocks away) I\'d have been able to see the towers falling from my 17th-floor cubicle.

properties.name: The 600-mile bike trip ended here
properties.description: Posted by Infojunkie Actually, the trip ended at the Grand Lake Lodge in the Rocky Mt National Park, when a car going backwards down a hill hit the clutch instead of the brakes and smashed my bike. We dragged our butts and stuff along to Steamboat, hung out with Justin for a bit, and then flew home, with about 600 of the 660 planned miles completed.
